titles.title: To make technical corrections in title 17, United States Code, and other laws.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts and Intellectual Property.
Subcommittee on Courts and Intellectual Property Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 106-84.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 46.

action.text: Mr. Coble moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1189.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.

bill.summary: 4/13/1999--Passed House amended. Makes technical corrections to Federal copyright law with respect to provisions under: (1) the Digital Millennium Copyright Act; and (2) the Online Copyright Infringement Liability Limitation Act. Amends related: (1) Federal judicial code provisions; and (2) Federal law provisions concerning government organization and employees. Amends the Vessel Hull Design Protection Act to exclude from protection under such Act a design embodied in a useful article that was made public by the designer or owner in the United States or a foreign country more than two years (currently, one year) before the application for registration date.
